content: hi there
my name is Jimmy Bradley and I'm a developer from the North East of England
in the United Kingdom today I'm here to talk to you about how I manage diabetes
with jump stock if you'd like to ask any questions outside of the talk then
please feel free to catch me on Twitter at Jared Li two three four and you can
also find my website which is at JB Bradley dev so first we're going to talk
about what diabetes is we're not going to spend too long talking about this
because we don't have a lot of time but what I would like you to do if you want
to find out more information is please check out my post on my website and the
link is below there so diabetes is a lifelong condition that causes a
person's blood sugar level to become too high and diabetes is categorized into
two groups I personally suffer from type 1 diabetes
and this means that my body is unable to create a hormone called insulin insulin
is a hormone that we need to regulate blood sugar levels inside of our
bloodstream type 2 diabetics are able to create some insulin but not enough in
comparison to a healthier individual if we don't have insulin and our blood
sugar levels become too high then we can get really ill and this means that we
can get something called ketoacidosis or ketones and it's effectively your poison
in your blood and it's not a very nice thing so how do we treat type type 1
diabetes how do we keep the blood sugars regulated well we do this with a
comparison of testing and taken medication what you can see here on
these pictures on the main picture on the left hand side a person is injecting
insulin into their body within it with an injection and we call this an insulin
pen on the bottom right hand side that individual has a machine like what I
have and this is called an insulin pump it's basically a machine that gradually
inject insulin into my body just by your machine rather than a physical injection
this person also has something called a continuous glucose monitor and I'm not
sure if you can see it but I have a lot of pink tape here to keep it down but I
have a continuous glucose monitor as well and what's happening is this
machine is continuously checking my blood sugar levels and
sending it over to this machine via bluetooth the machine is then Kim will
have taken those results and adjusting my insulin levels accordingly in the
background when we eat regardless of whether we're taking injection pens or
were on a machine like this we need to get an accurate blood sugar reading and
we do this with a blood sugar test so on the picture on the top right hand side
of the screen you can see that this is the machine that we would use to test
blood Sugar's individual would prick their fingers get the blood and put it
onto the strip the machine would then read the readings and we then have to
work out how much insulin we need to take based off that reading and based on
the amount of carbohydrates that we're about to eat in order to understand how
much insulin we need now treatment for diabetes is improved by looking at test
results from our blood sugar tests spotting trends and making changes now
I've kind of alluded to the fact that my machine is already doing this but once
upon a time I never had access to that technology and a lot of people across
the world don't have access to that technology so they would have to do it
manually and we can do that with a handful of tools you know there are apps
out there on Apple App Store Google Play Store but some of them require in-app
purchases to get premium features and that kind of sucks a little bit and it
would be nice if there was a maybe an open-source system where we could come
together as a community and put together features that we really need and a
system that we know will really work for us does the technology available to us
that I've already talked about which costs a lot of money so this machine
here itself cost three thousand pounds or three thousand you know British
pounds and the the monitor that I was talking about this little transmitter is
five hundred pounds very expensive especially if you you know unable to get
the funding in the UK or you know you don't have a National Health Service the
other alternative is to go back to basics which is what they told us to do
sixteen years ago which was to have a logbook where you would write down your
results in a table and then look at them which I found really hard I quite liked
the idea of having a graph in front of me so at the start of this year I
decided to take on a challenge I wanted to develop a community-driven blood
sugar management application because there isn't one there at the moment
and I wanted it to meet the following criteria I wanted to avoid these in-app
purchases I wanted to avoid these you know premium features I just wanted to
create an application that I knew would work for other diabetics and it would
give an opportunity for diabetics to come forward and contribute to the
application the application needs to be easy to host and deploy and I want you
to think of the experience as the one-click installers for WordPress that
you get on certain horse you just click the button and it's deployed and it
works it needs to be secured and it needs to be fast and of course I turn to
my good friends the John stuck because jump stock websites allow us to develop
websites and web applications that are fast secure easy to host and scalable as
well so this slide kind of gives you a high-level idea of how this is going to
work and we'll start by talking about the tooling we're going to use sanity as
the data management platform now a lot of people tend to use sanity is a
content management system but sunday is so flexible that you can create all
kinds of different applications with it and as we've proven here we're able to
create a blood sugar management application through it sanity will give
us the interface for the diabetics to go in and input their results it will also
take care of managing the data and storing the data as well for us we're
going to create a theme on Gatsby and use that as the front end of our website
this means that if we need to make changes and then release it so the
you're not suited to the user base then users can acquire updates by doing a
yarn off grid or an NPM upgrade and then the dependency will just get update it
accordingly which is really seamless and easy likewise on the sanity side we'll
do the same thing for the schema will create a sanity plug-in that will host
on NPM and then once we make changes and release them people can just perform the
necessary command to get hold of those changes we're also going to horse the
website on net Liffe I will also consider other alternatives as well but
to start with I decided that I wanted to go without the fie because it's the one
I'm most comfortable with and the one that I've worked with the most in terms
of getting the deployment together so we talked about this one click installation
method before we're going to look at the idea of incorporating the
incorporating the website with a net worth I'd deploy button on the github
readme file and then I'm also in the process of putting together a template
for sanity's create tool which means that you could go to Sun either I or
create and basically pick the template from a list and it would distribute the
application accordingly for you so this gives us a wide range of
benefits you're not doing it this way it means that we have an application that's
easy to deploy in horse through those one-click installers it's easy to manage
because we can use the upgrade commands from our appropriate packages package
manager sorry it's going to be open source so it means that the community
can come together and put ideas forward and make contributions the application
will be easy to use it would be easy to customize it will be secure it will be
fast and then if we move away from the technical aspects of it this means that
we will have an application that we can host on the internet and it will be easy
to share this data with healthcare professionals this is brilliant it means
that we don't have to sit there and you're not sure they did through a
mobile phone application or pull out the book and start going through all of the
different pages we can say to our doctors go to this link and filter down
this data and that's the this is where I'm having the problem and that means
that it's easy to visualize the data and spot the trends which makes a big
difference to the way that individuals manage their diabetes and of course it's
been built by a diabetic and hopefully more diabetics for diabetics so you you
know people who are behind it understand the problems that diabetics are facing
now this application is called hey sugar and if you'd like to find out more
information about the application you can go to the website which is hey sugar
dot health and the next few slides here I'm just going to show you some
screenshots of the application this is typically what the dash pod would look
like the idea is that it will show results from the last 30 days and it
will give you an average blood sugar so you can see what your average blood
sugar is going to be over the last 30 days it's very similar to the
functionality that we get with this machine here we can also see how many of
the results were clusters hyper which is a high reading and we can also see how
many results were clusters high poor which is a low reading finally the table
below will sure a list of all of the readings from
from the last 30 days and eventually we will be able to give users the ability
to switch that between a table view and a graph view moving on to the sunny side
of things we've given users the ability to configure the application through a
settings panel here you can see that this is where users would go to change
their measurement unit because it differs between different countries in
the across the globe you can also set a high limit which is the hyper limit and
you can set a low limit which is the hyper limit
I've also created this idea of a food bank so if you've ever used something
like MyFitnessPal you will know that you can create a bank of foods so that
instead of having to manually input all of the information over and over again
you can just reference a particular food from there and I want it to bring that
functionality into the application using some of these reference fields in the
schema design we're able to do that quite easily next this is the reading
screen so this is the screen where a user would come in to to put in their
blood sugars you can see that to be able to put the reading in the time in the
day it was logged that can see how they feed felt at the time of doing the test
because that makes a big difference on your blood Sugar's and that can say
whether they would take in the test before a meal after a meal or neither
another important factor is the alcohol flag because alcohol plays a big part in
an individual's blood sugar as well so the final screen that I wanted to show
you is this result screen so this is the screen that users would be able to go
into to see an individual results and you can see in the bottom left hand side
this is where the alcohol flag would appear if they tick the flag and that
takes me bung onto the 10-minute mark so thank you very much for coming along and
listening to my talk again i'm on twitter at gerry bradley two three four
if you'd like to find speak to me about any of this and also head over to heishi
without health for more information on the project thank you very much
you
